title: ClusterSeven Recognized as Best-of-Breed Provider in RiskTech Quadrant® for Enterprise GRC Solutions
text:
LONDON & NEW YORK--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- Company Ranked in Chartis RiskTech Quadrant ® for Enterprise GRC for Two Years in a Row 
ClusterSeven , a leading provider of end-user computing (EUC) management solutions, today announced that it has been ranked as a best-of-breed vendor in the Chartis enterprise GRC solutions RiskTech Quadrant ® for 2015. According to Chartis, vendors such as ClusterSeven have best-in-class point solution capabilities together with organizational characteristics to capture significant market share in their chosen target markets. 
In the report ClusterSeven’s Enterprise Spreadsheet Manager (ESM), Access Database Manager (ADM), and Inventory Management System (IMS) products were evaluated on two dimensions - market potential and completeness of offering. The 2015 report describes ClusterSeven as “a provider of strategic software for the management of user-built financial models and applications, including Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, QlikView®, Python and similar technology assets.” 
“ClusterSeven solutions enable companies to identify and manage the critical spreadsheets in use throughout the organization,” stated Peyman Mestchian , Managing Partner at Chartis. “By putting a governance layer around these critical spreadsheets, ClusterSeven helps companies improve data quality, lower manual costs, and mitigate risk.” 
“Our solutions help organizations validate and reconcile the unstructured risk data that resides in spreadsheets,” said Ralph Baxter , CEO and founder of ClusterSeven. “Once we validate the data our solutions can also integrate with enterprise GRC solutions so that the cleansed data is housed in a single data warehouse for reporting purposes.” 
In December of 2014, ClusterSeven was ranked number 81 in the Chartis RiskTech100 ® report. The company was also recognized as a Best-of-Breed provider in the Chartis Operational Risk Management Systems for Financial Services report issued in May of 2015. 
About Chartis 
Chartis is the leading provider of research and analysis on the global market for risk technology. Its goal is to support enterprises as they drive business performance through better risk management, corporate governance and compliance. Chartis helps clients make informed technology and business decisions by providing in-depth analysis and actionable advice on virtually all aspects of risk technology. 
RiskTech Quadrant ® and RiskTech100 ® are registered trademarks of Chartis Research limited. 
Chartis Research is authorized and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) for providing investment advice - ( www.chartis-research.com ). 
About ClusterSeven 
London-based ClusterSeven has developed a range of market-leading software products that provide oversight and transparency of a firm’s spreadsheets, user-built databases and modelling tools. ClusterSeven’s solutions give functions such as finance, risk and internal audit full confidence in the integrity of their firm’s spreadsheet data, while also offering substantial savings on the time and resources used to check data processes and accuracy. ClusterSeven was founded in 2003 and established a New York office in 2006. The firm now has a third of the world’s top 30 banks as clients as well as multiple leading insurers, investment managers and energy firms.
